page.title: 04THE CENTRE OF THE VILLAGE.
page.content: Also in the centre of the village of Woolseryis its only shop,the village stores and Post Office.Just below the shop is the Farmer's Arms,a thatched inn,which is reputed to have been built to house the monks who in turn built the church.It is certainly very old and has been an inn for generations. Opposite the inn is the manor house,now a restaurant but obviously once of greater importance. The road between these buildings leads to a crossway upon which is situated the village's county primary school.This was opened in 1879 as a Board school and has served the community for over one hundred years. Today it has about ninety pupils in four classes and is shortly to be remodelled leaving its attractive Victorian front and bringing its
